column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have never experienced anything worse than using this "medicine". I have chronic yeast infections, and I have tried ALL of the monistat products...with 2 trips to the ER and numerous home removals, this is just not worth it. It should be banned! The burning and itching goes from annoying to UNBEARABLE! I have cried my eyes out from the pain! All in all...monistat is a menace to the name of cure.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This does kill the infection. I'm glad I started off with the 7 day Monistat. I was researching the 1 day and 3 day that is more concentrated and I heard that the burning is worse. Upon application there is an instant burning on the inside. If I move around it's a little worse. It is very uncomfortable. I might switch back to clotrimazole, it didn't burn for me. Why would they make a product that burns so much?

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: One minute after the first application, I experienced a severe burning sensation of my vagina and vulva.  I thought it was because I was sore already because of the infection.  The second application had the same result severe enough to bring tears to my eyes.  I couldn't get to sleep until 2:00 in the morning because of the discomfort and awoke at 6:00 a.m. to its presence.  I, also, had to wash off the exterior area to help stop the burning.

column9: First time using over the counter brand - day one, very mild stinging thought it was the medication working and feel much more comfortable compared to how i was with the infection - seems to be working just as the prescribed medication has for me in the past.  Only negative is how messy it gets when it comes out during the day because your standing.
